result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik Bravo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $886 and includes this amount on the payment slip]. The Court also orders payment of $75 in drug testing fees in Case #15CM449.  The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive [on each case; these alternate sentences are concurrent to each other].

FINANCIAL NOTES: pp app rcvd at the counter.

[MK] cases #15CM449 and #17CM511 called at 2:15pm.  
Defendant Erik Bravo in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  DA Susan appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest  " entered on Case #17CM449-Count #1 and on Case #17CM511-Count #1; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses the remainder of the counts. 
-----------------------

On Case #15CM449-Count #1 and on 17CM511-Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Bravo on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment, treatment and follow through as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as may be required by the Agent
---to submit to random alcohol and drug testing
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all controlled substances medications only as prescribed by a treating physician
--no contact with any known drug offender exept for treatment and except as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $886 and includes this amount on the payment slip]. The Court also orders payment of $75 in drug testing fees in Case #15CM449.  The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive [on each case; these alternate sentences are concurrent to each other].

Days credit for time already served: 1 day on #15CM449; and 0 days credit in case #17CM51 

As to Case #17CM511 only:  the Court grant expungement conditional on Mr. Bravo successfully completing the Probation term.  The Court defines "successful completion" of the Probation term as there being no formal ATR's, no attempts to revoke, and that Mr. Bravo completes the entire 18 months of Probation with no early discharge.  
recess 2:23pm.

[MK] case called at 10:46am.
Defendant Erik Bravo in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is on the Court's calendar after Mr. Bravo was removed from the First Offender Program after alleged new criminal conduct.  ADA Teuber indicates that there is a new criminal case filing anticipated. 
The issue of defense-counsel representation is raised-- Attorney Dahnert was privately retained on the case previously, but now Mr. Bravo cannot afford her continued representation.  
The Court refers Mr. Bravo to the Public Defenders Office to apply for representation. 
recess 10:51am.

Case called at 8:31 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Erik Bravo in court with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert.  ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck confirms victim rights compliance; Court so finds
Atty Dahnert informs the Court that she had a PTC on Wednesday last week and Mr. Bravo has been referred to FOP; however, have not had enough time to set up meeting with Miss McCoy yet. Do plan on doing that today following hearing. Request the Court set additional STC and will inform the Court once Mr. Bravo has been accepted so that the STC can be removed from the calendar. 
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Beck indicates that it takes approximately 3 weeks to set appointment with FOP.
Court informs parties that It will set STC in approximately 5 weeks and informs parties that STC can be removed from calendar if notice is received that Mr. Bravo is accepted into FOP.
Recess: 8:35 am

Case called at 2:58 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for Initial Appearance)
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrIII]
Defendant Erik Bravo not in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall informs the Court that this case initiated as an in-custody, the State was given 30 days to file or the bond would lapse. The State did file within 30 days, so the bond is still in effect. Request warrant.
Court finds probable cause within the complaint and orders issuance of arrest warrant - Body Only
Court takes no action on bond
Recess: 3:00 pm

Case called at 1:19 pm [sf] [Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Branch 2]
Erik Bravo appears in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Flint informs the Court that the state needs more time to file a complaint and requests 30 days to file a complaint.
Court grants request, and finds Probable Cause and signs the Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
-No contact with N.J.K. (DOB: 9/18/1998), except in the presence of school personnel for a school function
-No contact with Tyrone Hummons
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

Recess: 1:23 pm
